replies.bodyText:
As I commented on #3234 currently one unit test fails depending on system timezone.
For offsets of GMT-1, UTC, GMT+xx the test passes (TZ=Etc/GMT±XX), e.g.
TZ=Europe/Oslo LANG=C mvn -Dtest=SiriAlertsUpdateHandlerTest\#testSiriSxUpdateForTrip test

but for offsets of GMT-12 to GMT-2 the test fails, e.g.
TZ=Europe/Helsinki LANG=C mvn -Dtest=SiriAlertsUpdateHandlerTest\#testSiriSxUpdateForTrip test

At least this suggested change is not enough to fix the unit test, but is it actually that unit test somehow misusing system locale instead of RT update code?
